Class P4_Evangelista_Andrew_Tree

java.lang.Object
P4_Evangelista_Andrew_Tree
public class P4_Evangelista_Andrew_Tree extends Object
The P4_Evangelista_Andrew_Tree class provides methods to draw a fractal tree using the gpdraw API. This class offers flexibility in controlling the starting position, branch length, and depth of recursion for the tree. Example usage: 
 P4_Evangelista_Andrew_Tree nice = new P4_Evangelista_Andrew_Tree(pad, 100,0);
        nice.setPos(100, 0);
        nice.drawTree(50,5);

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    P4_Evangelista_Andrew_Tree(gpdraw.SketchPad pad)
    Constructs a new fractal tree instance with a default starting position (centered at the bottom).
    P4_Evangelista_Andrew_Tree(gpdraw.SketchPad pad, double startX, double startY)
    Constructs a new fractal tree instance with a specified starting position.

    • setPos

      public P4_Evangelista_Andrew_Tree setPos(double x, double y)
      Sets the starting position for the base of the tree.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate for the base of the tree
      y - the y-coordinate for the base of the tree
      Returns:
      the current tree instance for chaining

    • drawTree

      public void drawTree(double branchLength, int depth)
      Draws the fractal tree based on the provided branch length and depth of recursion.
      Parameters:
      branchLength - initial length of the tree's main branch
      depth - number of recursive steps for the tree drawing
